entry.title: Woman lodged on nine charges after leading police on car chase
entry.summary: Dec. 29, 2023 1:15 p.m. Roseburg Police arrested Tahnie West on multiple charges stemming from a short car chase Thursday afternoon in Roseburg. West allegedly stole a car from the Domino’s parking lot on West Harvard Avenue around 4 p.m. The vehicle owner had left the car running and unlocked while he went inside the...

entry.title: Man arrested for alleged choking incident at dump
entry.summary: Dec. 29, 2023 1:10 p.m. Roseburg Police arrested a 35-year-old Roseburg man on strangulation and harassment charges Thursday afternoon. Officers reportedly responded to a disturbance at a residence on Southeast Houck around 1:30 p.m. A 35-year-old woman allegedly claimed she was choked by a man while at the Douglas County landfill. When the man and...

entry.title: Roseburg man arrested on assault and strangulation charges
entry.summary: Dec. 29, 2023 11:45 a.m. Roseburg Police arrested a 27-year-old Roseburg man after an alleged assault Thursday morning. RPD reports that officers were called to a residence on Northeast Russel Avenue for a disturbance just after 9 a.m. The suspect allegedly covered the victim’s mouth, impeding her ability to breath. The suspect allegedly fled the...

entry.title: Three Roseburg residents arrested after alleged road rage incident
entry.summary: Dec. 29, 2023 11:45 a.m. An alleged road rage incident Thursday morning led to three Roseburg residents landing in jail on multiple charges. The Roseburg Police Department says it was alerted to a situation involving a Chevy Avalanche and a recreational vehicle that started in the Hucrest area and continued out of town. Officers and...

entry.title: Woman steals vehicle, leads police on short chase
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Tahnie Amber West allegedly took a vehicle from the Domino's parking lot and led police on a chase on Interstate 5.

entry.title: Trio arrested for road rage that ends in assault, kidnapping
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Three people were arrested following a road rage incident Thursday morning in Roseburg.

entry.title: Deadline Approaching for Local Educator Grant Applications
entry.summary: 12/29/2023 9:30 a.m. The deadline is approaching for educators in Douglas County to apply for grants through the Fund for Teachers. Officials with the Roseburg Public School District said this is a chance for educators to enhance their teaching journey through grants of up to $5,000 for individuals, and up to $10,000 for teams. The...

entry.title: Umpqua Community Veg Education Group offers healthy lifestyle course
entry.summary: A new year brings new resolutions and some will be tackling the goal of taking back their health.

entry.title: Tree falls in Roseburg yard, no injuries reported
entry.summary: Kristen Anderson parked her car at 5:45 a.m. Thursday at the duplex on Southeast Giles Street in Roseburg where she lives.

entry.title: Wildlife Safari Seeking Year End Gifts
entry.summary: Dec. 29, 2023 6:25 a.m. Wildlife Safari kicked off three new projects this year and is seeking year end donations. The projects are: *The Barnyard: a renovation of the children’s zoo *The Rhino Boma Project *The Giraffe Squeeze The Barnyard project will allow for hands-on interaction with children’s zoo animals, including friendly goats and sheep....

entry.title: Winston City Council Meeting Canceled
entry.summary: Dec. 29, 2023 6:25 a.m. Due to a lack of business items, Wednesday’s meeting of the Winston City Council has been canceled. Winston city offices will be closed on Monday. They will close again on January 15th for the Martin Luther King Jr. holiday. For more information about the City of Winston, go to: https://winstoncity.org/

entry.title: County Government to Close on Monday For New Years
entry.summary: Dec. 29, 2023 6:20 a.m. Douglas County government offices will be closed on Monday for New Year’s Day. A County release said that includes the courthouse, Justice Building, county annex in Reedsport, transfer stations, fairgrounds and all external county government offices. The Umpqua River Lighthouse Museum in Winchester Bay will be open on Monday for...

entry.title: Winter Break at the Library Concludes Saturday
entry.summary: Dec. 29, 2023 6:20 a.m. Winter Break at the Library concludes Saturday, presented by Friends of the Myrtle Creek Library. Activities take place from 12:00 p.m. to 4:00 p.m. both days. On Friday, it’s a Movie Day, with Read-to-a-Dog happening on Saturday. The library is a 231 Northeast Division Street in Myrtle Creek. For more...

entry.title: Festival of Lights Wraps Up Sunday Night
entry.summary: Dec. 29, 20023 6:20 a.m. The Umpqua Valley Festival of Lights at River Forks Park wraps up Sunday night. Presented by the Roseburg Rotary Club, it features over 90 displays and more than 500,000 lights. Tickets are $10 per vehicle. They can be obtained at the event or online. Started in 1993, proceeds from the...

entry.title: William 'Andrew' Ernst promoted as Roseburg UScellular store manager
entry.summary: William “Andrew” Ernst has years of sales and managing experience at UScellular — the fourth-largest full-service wireless carrier in the United States — and now he’s been promoted to store manager for Roseburg’s location at 780 NW Garden Valley Blvd.

entry.title: Douglas County employers add 60 jobs in November
entry.summary: Douglas County payroll employment increased a seasonally adjusted 60 jobs in November after a decrease of 240 in October and an increase of 70 in September.

entry.title: Wolf Creek man jailed after DUII incident
entry.summary: CANYONVILLE — Deputies with the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office jailed a Wolf Creek man after an alleged DUII incident early Wednesday.

entry.title: Vehicles collide on Interstate 5
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Two vehicles collided Monday on Interstate 5 northbound near the fairgrounds exit south of Roseburg.

entry.title: Broken insulator leads to power outage
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Broken insulators led to a lengthy power outage for thousands of Roseburg area residents Wednesday.

entry.title: Umpqua Lighthouse State Park hosts free guided walk Monday
entry.summary: REEDSPORT — Umpqua Lighthouse State Park will host a group hike around Lake Marie on Monday as one of 34 First Day Hikes offered at 31 Oregon State Parks.

entry.title: Myrtle Creek children write their own story at library
entry.summary: MYRTLE CREEK — A cat dons a spacesuit and ventures into space with its mermaid friend. They pass an alien, a robot, the planet Mars and circle back to Earth just in time to stop an asteroid from hitting the…

entry.title: Garage fire leads to roof collapse
entry.summary: A garage fire led to a roof collapse on Tuesday morning, southeast of Winston.

entry.title: Winter Whale Watch Week: Gray whales travel along the Oregon Coast
entry.summary: Winter Whale Watch Week returns Wednesday.
